short_description: SQL/MR function to train a ner model.
long_description: SQL/MR function to train a ner model.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains the training data.
input_tables.description: The relation that contains the training data.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.rDescription: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the database where the input table is located.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database password of the user.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.rDescription: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.rDescription: The password for the SSL truststore.
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: TextColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the text to analyze.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the text to analyze.

argument_clauses.name: ModelFile
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the model file that the function generates and installs in Aster Database.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the model file that the function generates and installs in Aster Database.

argument_clauses.name: FeatureTemplate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the file that specifies how to generate features when training the model. You must install this feature template file in Aster Database under the user search path before calling the function. For more information about template_file, refer to “Feature Template”
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the file that specifies how to generate features when training the model. You must install this feature template file in Aster Database under the user search path before calling the function. For more information about template_file, refer to “Feature Template”

argument_clauses.name: Language
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the language of the input text: • en (English, the default) • zh_CN (Simplified Chinese) • zh_TW (Traditional Chinese)
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the language of the input text: • en (English, the default) • zh_CN (Simplified Chinese) • zh_TW (Traditional Chinese)

argument_clauses.name: Eta
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the tolerance of the termination criterion. Defines the differences of the values of the loss function between two sequential epochs. The default value is 0.0001. When training a model, the function performs n-times iterations. At the end of each epoch, the function calculates the loss or cost function on the training samples. If the loss function value change is very small between two sequential epochs, the function considers the training process to have converged. The function defines eta as: Eta=(f(n)-f(n-1))/f(n-1), where f(n) is the loss function value of the nth epoch.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the tolerance of the termination criterion. Defines the differences of the values of the loss function between two sequential epochs. The default value is 0.0001. When training a model, the function performs n-times iterations. At the end of each epoch, the function calculates the loss or cost function on the training samples. If the loss function value change is very small between two sequential epochs, the function considers the training process to have converged. The function defines Eta as: Eta=(f(n)-f(n-1))/f(n-1), where f(n) is the loss function value of the nth epoch.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of iterations. The default value is '1000'
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations. The default value is '1000'

argument_clauses.name: MinOccurNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the minimum number times that a feature must occur in the input text before the function uses the feature to construct the model. The default value is 0.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the minimum number times that a feature must occur in the input text before the function uses the feature to construct the model. The default value is 0.

argument_clauses.name: ExtractorJar
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the JAR file that contains the Java classes that extract features. You must install this JAR file in Aster Database under the user search path before calling the function. Note: The name jar_file is case-sensitive.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the JAR file that contains the Java classes that extract features. You must install this JAR file in Aster Database under the user search path before calling the function. Note: The name jar_file is case-sensitive.
